remarks: If the restriction of a function by a set which, subtracted from the domain of the function so that its difference is finitely supported, the function itself is finitely supported.  (Contributed by AV, 27-May-2019.)
statement:
resfsupp.b $e |- ( ph -> ( dom F \ B ) e. Fin ) $.
resfsupp.e $e |- ( ph -> F e. W ) $.
resfsupp.f $e |- ( ph -> Fun F ) $.
resfsupp.g $e |- ( ph -> G = ( F |` B ) ) $.
resfsupp.s $e |- ( ph -> G finSupp Z ) $.
resfsupp.z $e |- ( ph -> Z e. V ) $.
resfsupp $p |- ( ph -> F finSupp Z ) $.
